intro: Aspilia belo-horizontinae, commonly known as the Belo Horizonte torchflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces vibrant yellow to orange flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its striking floral display and drought tolerance.
